headline: Security Best Practices You Should Know

digest_items.title: Review third-party vendor access
digest_items.why: Excessive vendor permissions increase attack surface and compliance risk
digest_items.fix: Audit vendor access quarterly and apply principle of least privilege

digest_items.title: Verify CORS configuration
digest_items.why: Misconfigured CORS can allow unauthorized cross-origin requests
digest_items.fix: Explicitly whitelist allowed origins instead of using '*'

digest_items.title: Verify patch management process
digest_items.why: Unpatched systems are vulnerable to known exploits
digest_items.fix: Establish regular patching schedule and test updates before deployment

digest_items.title: Implement rate limiting on APIs
digest_items.why: Rate limits prevent brute force attacks and API abuse
digest_items.fix: Use middleware like express-rate-limit or nginx limit_req module

digest_items.title: Rotate API keys quarterly
digest_items.why: Regular rotation limits the window of exposure if keys are compromised
digest_items.fix: Set calendar reminders and use secret management tools like HashiCorp Vault

digest_items.title: Implement DMARC policy
digest_items.why: DMARC builds on SPF and DKIM to give domain owners control over email authentication
